clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Alendronate in Chinese Children or Adolescents With Osteogenesis Imperfecta
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy and Safety of Alendronate in Chinese Children or Adolescents With Osteogenesis Imperfecta: an Age Stratified Prospective Study

collaborator.agency: National Natural Science Foundation of China

brief_summary.textblock: Alendronate should be considered as an alternative therapy of osteogenesis imperfecta (OI) because it significantly increased areal bone mineral density (BMD) and its Z score, decreased fracture incidence, inhibited bone resorption biomarkers. Alendronate exerted beneficial roles in different age brackets, especially in young patients with OI.

primary_outcome.measure: changes from baseline of areal BMD at lumbar spine and total hip

arm_group.arm_group_label: an open label, prospective, self-controlled study
arm_group.description: Children or adolescents under the age of 18 years old with minor trauma fracture were recruited from 30 provinces of China. The diagnosis of OI was made by endocrinology department of Peking Union Medical College Hospital(PUMCH).
